title: remove: fails to remove in --recursive, demands --recursive option
body:
```shell
smaug:~/proj/repronim/containers
*$> datalad remove --nocheck -r /home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc/
[WARNING] path constraints did not match an installed subdataset: /home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc/sourcedata 
[WARNING] path constraints did not match an installed subdataset: /home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc/containers 
[ERROR  ] to be uninstalled dataset Dataset(/home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc) has present subdatasets, forgot --recursive? [remove(/home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc)] 
remove(error): /home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc (dataset) [to be uninstalled dataset Dataset(/home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc) has present subdatasets, forgot --recursive?]

$> datalad --version
datalad 0.13.1

# is it a symlink?
$> readlink -f /home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc/
/home/yoh/.tmp/repro-Ut8tPTv/ds000003-qc
```

The script used to produce that dataset is https://github.com/ReproNim/containers#a-typical-workflow and to reproduce you could cut/paste or

```
git clone http://github.com/ReproNim/containers
bash <(sed -n -e '/^ *#!/,/^ *$/p' containers/README.md) 
```
